headline.main: When Parents Can't Enroll in Medicaid, Children Stay Uninsured

docs.abstract: When states fail to expand Medicaid for parents, there's an unintended impact on children.
docs.snippet: When states fail to expand Medicaid for parents, there's an unintended impact on children.

docs.abstract: Consumers say they find making health benefits choices confusing and complicated.
docs.snippet: Consumers say they find making health benefits choices confusing and complicated.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge.

headline.seo: Obama Faces Test as Deficit Stays Above $1 Trillion
headline.main: Test for Obama as Deficit Stays Over $1 Trillion
headline.print_headline: Test for Obama As Deficit Stays Over $1 Trillion

docs.abstract: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge; deficit for the fiscal year 2012, despite small annual improvements, will surpass $1 trillion for the fourth straight time; fiscal imbalance on Obama's watch has saddled him with one of his biggest vulnerabilities.
docs.snippet: President Obama and Mitt Romney have very different ideas on reducing the budget deficit, but experts have doubts that either plan is up to the challenge.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the high-stakes Senate race still very close, Senator Scott P. Brown is seeking to convert almost everything into a character attack on Elizabeth Warren.

headline.seo: In Massachusetts, Brown Attacks Warren’s Character
headline.main: In Massachusetts, Brown Attacks Warren’s Character
headline.print_headline: In Close Massachusetts Senate Race, Brown Attacks Warren’s Character

docs.abstract: Republican Sen Scott Brown of Massachusetts, pressing on in his high-stakes re-election campaign, is relying heavily on character attacks against his opponent, Democrat Elizabeth Warren.
docs.snippet: With the high-stakes Senate race still very close, Senator Scott P. Brown is seeking to convert almost everything into a character attack on Elizabeth Warren.

docs.lead_paragraph: Demographics alone suggest that regardless of who is the next president, the government is going to wind up distributing more of the nation’s wealth than it does today.

headline.seo: Obama and Romney’s ‘Redistribution’ Debate Has a Gray Area
headline.main: In Romney-Obama ‘Redistribution’ Debate, a Gray Area

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column contends that despite campaign-trail rhetoric, demographics alone suggest that the government is going to redistribute more of the nation's wealth in the future than it does today, regardless of who is the next president.
docs.snippet: Demographics alone suggest that regardless of who is the next president, the government is going to wind up distributing more of the nation’s wealth than it does today.

headline.main: Why the Health Care Tax Credit Eludes Many Small Businesses

docs.abstract: The G.A.O. concluded that the credit was too small to sway business owners. Moreover, it said, claiming the credit is a task so complicated as to discourage many companies from trying.
docs.snippet: The G.A.O. concluded that the credit was too small to sway business owners. Moreover, it said, claiming the credit is a task so complicated as to discourage many companies from trying.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Antibiotic Prescription? It May Depend on Where You Live

docs.abstract: Older men and women in the South are more often prescribed antibiotics than older Americans elsewhere, suggesting greater rates of antibiotic overuse in that part of the country.
docs.snippet: Older men and women in the South are more often prescribed antibiotics than older Americans elsewhere, suggesting greater rates of antibiotic overuse in that part of the country.

headline.main: How Many Government Programs Have You Benefited From?

docs.abstract: Research from Cornell University says that 96 percent of us have used one or more of these 21 government programs.
docs.snippet: Research from Cornell University says that 96 percent of us have used one or more of these 21 government programs.

docs.lead_paragraph: By refusing to supply America with intelligent answers, all the reliable national polls now show that his campaign is driving voters away.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends Mitt Romney's remarks about violent Muslim protests in Egypt and Libya and the leaked statements he made during a private fund-raiser are responsible for his dip in the polls; warns Romney that he should not be surprised if voters are increasingly turned off by his shallow and cavalier campaign.
docs.snippet: By refusing to supply America with intelligent answers, all the reliable national polls now show that his campaign is driving voters away.

docs.lead_paragraph: A panel of medical experts reaffirmed a recommendation intended to direct patients with risky drinking behaviors into counseling.

headline.seo: Doctors Reminded to Screen for Alcohol Problems
headline.main: Panel Reminds Doctors to Screen for Alcohol Misuse
headline.print_headline: Doctors Reminded to Ask Patients About Alcohol Use

docs.abstract: United States Preventive Services Task Force reaffirms that primary care doctors should screen their adult patients to determine whether they are misusing alcohol, and provide counseling when risky behavior is detected; reports that alcohol misuse results in an estimated 85,000 deaths a year, making it the third-leading cause of preventable death in the United States.
docs.snippet: A panel of medical experts reaffirmed a recommendation intended to direct patients with risky drinking behaviors into counseling.
